oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:title: Air Force One in Nashville
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:description: Lyndon Baines Johnson's arrival in Nashville on March 15, 1967. Photo of Air Force One on the runway.

Lyndon B. Johnson (1908-1973) was the 36th President of the United States from 1963-1969 and was John F. Kennedy's Vice President until Kennedy's assassination. Lady Bird Johnson (1912-2007) broke new ground by interacting directly with Congress and beautifying the nation's cities and highways. On March 15, 1967, President Lyndon B. Johnson and his wife Lady Bird Johnson made a day-long trip to Nashville. The Tennessee General Assembly invited Johnson to speak at a joint session to commemorate the 200th anniversary of the birth of President Andrew Jackson. Their one-day tour resulted in trips to the Hermitage, the Polk House, Ellington Agricultural Center, Columbia State Community College, and the Tennessee State Capitol.
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:source: Pres. Lyndon B. Johnson's Visit to Middle Tennessee Photographs
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:subject: Airports; Airport terminals; Airplanes
